content:
Sustainable fashion is often seen as expensive compared to fast fashion. However, there are several ways to make sustainable fashion accessible to a wider audience, including:

1. Secondhand shopping: Buying used clothing not only reduces waste but is also affordable. Secondhand shopping has become more popular with apps like Depop, Poshmark, and ThredUp making it easier to resell clothing.

2. Renting clothes: Renting high-end clothing instead of buying them often allows access to fashionable clothes at a reduced cost. It is a trend that has caught on with the rise of online rental services such as Rent the Runway.

3. Sustainable brands and collections: Some brands are committed to sustainability, such as H&M’s Conscious Collection, which uses organic materials from sustainable sources. Shopping at such brands can be a way of supporting sustainable practices.

4. DIY and upcycling: Revamping and upcycling old clothes instead of disposing of them often provides an easier, affordable pathway to incorporating more sustainable practices to fashion.

5. Supporting local artisans: There has been a rise in locally made fashion, often handmade in specific communities. Purchasing fashion items from artisans involved in sustainable production helps promote and establish sustainable fashion practices.

By encouraging the growth of a more sustainable fashion industry, many affordable sustainable fashion choices can become accessible to a wider audience. Making choices to purchase items that reduce environmental impact and embracing timeless fashion that can be worn for an extended period of time, is both economically and environmentally useful.
